l4/sys/semaphore.h

00024 /*****************************************************************************/
00025 #pragma once
00026 
00027 #include <l4/sys/types.h>
00028 
00029 /*****************************************************************************
00030  *** Prototypes
00031  *****************************************************************************/
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * \defgroup l4_sem_api Semaphore
00035  * \ingroup l4_kernel_object_api
00036  *
00037  * \brief Class definition of the Semaphore object.
00038  *
00039  * <c>\#include <l4/sys/semaphore.h> </c>
00040  *
00041  * The semaphore class provides a fast user-level
00042  * semaphore implementation. The main idea is to only invoke the micro kernel
00043  * in the contention case and to do everything else with atomic
00044  * read-modify-write instructions on user level.
00045  *
00046  * The semaphore currently implements a priority sorted list of threads that are
00047  * blocked on a semaphore. However, the semaphore does not implement measures
00048  * to prevent priority inversion. Therefore a more pessimistic implementation
00049  * would be necessary.
00050  *
00051  * Every semaphore kernel object has to be accompanied by a user-level data
00052  * structure that contains a counter.
00053  *
00054  * To create a semaphore kernel object see \ref l4_factory_api
00055  * (l4_factory_create_semaphore()).
00056  */
00057 
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * \brief Semaphore operations.
00061  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00062  * \internal
00063  */
00064 enum l4_sem_ops_t
00065 {
00066   L4_USEM_SLEEP = 6,
00067   L4_USEM_WAKEUP = 7,
00068 };
00069 
00070 /*
00071  * \brief Result values of the semaphore down operation.
00072  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00073  */
00074 enum l4_u_semaphore_ret_t
00075 {
00076   L4_USEM_OK      = 0, 
00077   L4_USEM_RETRY   = 1, 
00078   L4_USEM_TIMEOUT = 2, 
00079   L4_USEM_INVALID = 3  
00080 };
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * \brief Semaphore structure.
00084  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00085  */
00086 typedef struct l4_u_semaphore_t
00087 {
00088   l4_mword_t counter; /*< Counter */
00089   l4_umword_t flags;  /*< Flags */
00090 } __attribute__((aligned(sizeof(l4_umword_t)*2))) l4_u_semaphore_t;
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * \brief Initialize semaphore data structure.
00094  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00095  * \param count   Initial counter value
00096  * \param sem     Semaphore data structure pointer
00097  *
00098  * The counter value should be greater than zero and indicates how
00099  * many threads can enter the critical section.
00100  *
00101  * \note After initialization this data stucture should never be
00102  *       touched by any application.
00103  */
00104 L4_INLINE void
00105 l4_usem_init(long count, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) L4_NOTHROW;
00106 
00107 /*
00108  * \brief Semaphore down operation with timeout.
00109  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00110  * \param ksem    Capability selector to semaphore object
00111  * \param sem     Pointer to semaphore data structure
00112  * \param timeout Absolute or relative timeout
00113  *
00114  * The timeout specifies the maximum time a thread blocks
00115  * while trying to acquire the semaphore.
00116  *
00117  * \return See #l4_u_semaphore_t
00118  */
00119 L4_INLINE l4_msgtag_t
00120 l4_usem_down_to(l4_cap_idx_t ksem, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem,
00121                 l4_timeout_s timeout) L4_NOTHROW;
00122 
00123 /*
00124  * \brief Semaphore down operation with infinite timeout.
00125  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00126  * \param ksem    Capability selector to semaphore object
00127  * \param sem     Pointer to semaphore data structure
00128  *
00129  * The thread blocks without any timeout while waiting 
00130  * for the semaphore.
00131  *
00132  * \return See #l4_u_semaphore_t
00133  */
00134 //todo can this operation fail???
00135 L4_INLINE l4_msgtag_t
00136 l4_usem_down(l4_cap_idx_t ksem, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) L4_NOTHROW;
00137 
00138 /*
00139  * \brief Semaphore up operation.
00140  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00141  * \param ksem    Capability selector to semaphore object
00142  * \param sem     Pointer to semaphore data structure
00143  *
00144  * \pre This function should only be called after a successful l4_sem_down
00145  *      operation.
00146  */
00147 L4_INLINE l4_msgtag_t
00148 l4_usem_up(l4_cap_idx_t ksem, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) L4_NOTHROW;
00149 
00150 
00151 
00152 /*****
00153  * Implementations
00154  */
00155 #include <l4/sys/__semaphore_impl.h>
00156 
00157 
00158 L4_INLINE void
00159 l4_usem_init(long count, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) L4_NOTHROW
00160 {
00161   sem->counter = count;
00162   sem->flags = 0;
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 L4_INLINE l4_msgtag_t
00167 l4_usem_down(l4_cap_idx_t ksem, l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) L4_NOTHROW
00168 {
00169   return l4_usem_down_to(ksem, sem, L4_IPC_TIMEOUT_NEVER);
00170 }
00171
